cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi SE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across Puerto Rico and the Greater Antilles, then toward Cuba and the Gulf of Mexico

weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), U.S. & British Virgin Islands, N & S coasts of the Dominican Republic, N coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Hispaniola, eastern Cuba, and eventually the north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained ≈45 mph with higher gusts) expected Saturday at San Juan
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, generally below 2 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated 8 inches leading to flash and urban flooding and possible mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents; potential mudslides in steep terrain
